Name: The Absent Rule
Flavor A: As the Argo leaves the Knossos port, you look to the Horned City one last time. Not many have come to see you off, but a glint from the palace confirms your suspicions: spying eyes are set upon you.\nThe Cretans delivered fuel and supplies as promised. Enough to subsist, but only jusy. Is it all they could spare, or a short leash? Either way, you should stick to the coast.\nWithout much to go on, you fall back on the basics: scout the island, question the locals
Summary A: Collect Progress
Rules A: If you skipped the Tutorial, create the Cycle I exploration deck: find Cycle I Exploration cards 1-9, 13, 19, 23, and 28-32, and shuffle them. Take the Cycle I Map tile [027|A027] and place it on the table. Place the Argo on that tile. Mark day 0 on the Timeline. Proceed to the first step of the Campaign Round.\nTo progress through the story you must gather @Progress. Each time you gain @Progress, place a @Progress token either on the current Story card or on the Inward Odyssey card.\nIf the [Minoan Guide|AC0072] is with you, immediately place 1 @Progress token on this card. When there are 6 or more @Progress tokens on this card, flip the card to side 1B
Flavor B:
Minos is a hard man to find. The scraps of information you do manage to uncover inevitably lead to a dead end: a missing fisherman, a burned down temple, a murdered philosopher. It doesn't help that the Minoans are not as forthcoming as you would like. It seems the king held the island in too tight a grip, and there are many who would prefer him to remain missing.
A lesser crew would give up on this fruitless search. But not you. Even the absence of clues is in itself a clue. Someone has been covering their tracks.
There's talk of foreigners supposedly looking for the same prize you're after. Not far from your current position, atop a mount on an artificial island, stands an unfinished Cretan wonder known to some as the City of the Bull. Construction halted when the Great Mourning began--yet now there are rumors of foreign ships coming and going under the cover of night.
It might be prudent to pay it a visit
Summary B: Reach the City of the Bull
Rules B:
Place the City of the Bull marker on the closest unoccupied @City symbol.
If there are no unoccupied @City symbols on the Map, place the marker on thisc ard instead. Then, when you reveal a Map tile with a @City symbol, immediately place the City of the Bull marker on that @City symbol.
You cannot use *Negotation* abilities on a @City covered by the City of the Bull marker.
*Finding the City:* If the _Argo_ is on the Mpa tile with the City of the Bull marker, during the Story Step, see 0002

Name: A Fateful Randezvous
Flavor A: It seems King Minos may have found himself some new friends in this "Symmachy" you've been hearing about. But to choose foreign power over his own daughters? Strange and ominous. Eitehr something is rotten at the core of the Minoan Dynasty... or Minos was taken prisoner and the Symmachy are using old animosities to stir the already boiling pot that is Crete.\nEither way, this "Symmachy" is involved and your mission remains the same. You concentrate your efforts on finding the foreign ship, the Marathonian
Summary A: Collect Progress and follow the clues
Rules A: When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge.\nTake the four Story 2A Clue cards and shuffle the,. When you place your 2nd @Progress token on this card, draw one of the four 2A Clue cards and return the rest to the box. You need to find the Map tile shown on the card. Correctly match the clue from the card to the clue on the Map tile to find what to do next!\nYou can contineu placing @Progress tokens on this card (up to 9). They may come in handy later. Alternatively, you may wish to learn more about the _Argo_ through the Inward Odyssey...
Flavor B:
The Symmachy flagship has fled upriver. You're not sure what their plan is or how far the Argo can sail in shallow waters, but you have little choise: Minos is on that ship. Willingly or not, he will come with you, and you will be done with this cursed island once and for all.
You give pursuit. Even a few miles inland, the landscape starts to change, become more angular, more... artificial. Your scouts reported as much, but seeing this with your own eyes, hills slowly turning into stepped terraces like the Egyptain pyramids, or peach and persimmon trees bearing cube-shaped fruit, is something else.
Crete is being remade and seemingly nothing can stop it.
You must find Minos
Summary B: Catch up to the Flagship
Rules B: Find the ten Story 2B Clue cards, set aside the [Symmachy Flagship|AC0066] card and shuffle the rest. Then randomly remove a number of these Clue cards equal to the number of @Progress tokens you had on Story 2A and return them to the box (without looking). Finally, shuffle the _Symmachy Flagship_ card with the remaining Clue cards to create the Pursuit deck.\n*Looking for the Flagship:* If the _Argo_ is on a *river* (a Map tile with the @River symbol in the bottom right corner), during the Story Step, draw 1 card from the Pursuit deck and resolve it, then remove it form the game (return it to the box)

Name: A Phantom Thread
Flavor A: Your meeting with the Symmachy has left you with more questions than answers. You have no reason to believe anything Militiades said--but you could say the same about the about the Minoan Dynasty. The only difference is, Minos's daughters hold the keys to the Daedalus Vault, wherein you hope to find parts to fix the Argo. Or so they claim.\nFrom what you've learned, Minos, if he is still alive, is heading for the grave of Ariadne at the Sepulcher Acropolis. The Acropolis is hidden, but Daedalus, its builder, left clues to its location at several sites across Crete.\n Thankfully, you've got a map
Summary A: Locate the Sepulcher Acropolis
Rules A:
When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge.
Take the five Story 3A Clue cards and shuffle them to create the Temple deck.
If the _Argo_ is on a Map tile with the Minotaur Temple symbol, during the Story Step, you may search it by drawing and resolving a card from the Temple deck. If the card shows any coordinates, these coordinates are forever tied to the Map tile they were drawn on. You can search each Minotaur Temple only once. Note searched Temples in the Map section of the Argo Sheet.
You can collect @Progress to quicken your search. Resolve the effects below when you place the designeated number of @Progress tokens on this card.
2 @Progress: Reveal the top card from the Temple deck and discard it. This is not considered drawing a card.
5 @Progress: Reveal the top card from the Temple deck and discard it. This is not considered drawing a card.
9 @Progress: Draw the top card from the Temple deck and resolve it.
When you find the full set of coordinates of the Sepulcher Acropolis, turn this card to side 3B
Flavor B: You've traveled Crete far and wide, uncovering cryptic clues left by the Great Inventor, Daedalus. Many a time you've asked yourselves: why hide a necropolis? Why leave clues leading to it? For whom?\nMaybe Minos will be able to provide some answers.... once you find him. If he's alive. As you put together the fragmented information from the many Minotaur Temples visited, you pinpoint the location of the Sepulcher Acropolis.\nYou set your course
Summary B: Reach the Sepulcher Acropolis
Rules B: Place the Sepulcher Acropolis marker on the Map tile shown by the coordinates. If it is unexplored, place the marker on this card instead. Then, when you reveal the Map tile designated by the coordinates, immediately place the Sepulcher Acropolis marker on this tile.\n*Find the Sepulcher Acropolis:* If the _Argo_ is on the same Map tile as the Sepulcher Acropolis marker, during the Story Step, see 0075

Name: Unappealable Egress
Flavor A:
There are many things that you still don't understand, but the hour grows late, and Crete's twilight is at hand. Soon there will be no way of stopping the reality-bending Truth. Minos is gone and with him, the true line of Minoan rulers seemingly ends. Your contract with the Minoan Dynasty cannot be fulfilled.
Ironically, the Sepulcher Acropolis housed the Daedalus Vault, the very place you've risked your neck for. With the parts found within, Alkabiades mends the Argo. You can finally leave this accursed island behind.
Yet you remain. For during your journey you've learned that mere survival is not enough. This world desperately needs hope heroes--and you will provide both. This is your purpose.
The Last Academy is creating a machina that will amplify the ontological field surrounding the grave of Ariadne and make the Temenos vulnerable. They call it Ariadne's Anchor.
You rush to Knossos to have a word with the self-proclaimed mouth of the Labyrinth, the Punished, now a prisoner of the Minoan Dynasty, to lure the creature out
Summary A: Collect Progress and reach Knossos
Rules A:
When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge.
If the Minoan Guide is with you, see 0089.
If the Old Spinner is with you, immediately place 1 @Progress token on this card.
*Dog Days Are Over:* Permanently remove the [Dog Days|AB0075] Exploration card from the Exploration deck (return it to the box).
You need to create the Ariadne's Anchor and rush back to Knossos.
*Reach Knossos:* If the Argo is on the Knossos Map tile (027) and there are 5 or more @Progress tokens on this card, the Anchor is complete. During the Story Step, see 0104 (*Warning: Point of No Return*).
*Upgrade the Anchor:* When there are 12 or more @Progress tokens on this card, flip to side 4B
Flavor B: Ariande's Anchor is complete, with time to spare. The scholars of the Last Academy can perfect the design.The ontological field seems to have more properties than just anchoring an object to reality: some of the philosophers propose it may be used to conjure up a "theatre-like" reality environment, a waking dream to explore the endless possibilities of life. But that is for the future.\nOne day, the scholars find a giant xiphos lying on the floor of the Anchor's chamber, with no idea how it got there
Summary B: Reach Knossos
Rules B: Gain the [Theseus Razor|AJ0268] @Gear card (Secret deck 2, Card 14) and the [Temenos Sighting] Technology card (unless you already have it). Then, immediately go on an adventure from the Dreams Laid Bare hub (if you finished this hub already, choose another hub to go on an adventure from!).\nWith the Ariadne's Anchor upgraded and operational, it is time to head to Knossos.\n*Reach Knossos:* If the Argo is on the Knossos Map tile (027) and there are 5 or more @Progress tokens on this card, the Anchor is complete. During the Story Step, see 0104 (*Warning: Point of No Return*)

Name: Inward Odyssey: Truth Of The Labyrinth
Flavor A: You know precious little about the grand vessel you call home. Who built it? For what purpose? How did you come to be onboard?\nThere are vast spaces below deck, more than should be possible, even taking into account the massive size of the ship. Each day brings a new discovery, a new secret to be unraveled. Your Inward Odyssey has just begun
Rules A:
When there are 2 @Progress tokens on this card, discard them and gain +1 @ArgoKnowledge.
When you reach a given @ArgoKnowledge level, during the Story Step, after all other Story events, resolve the corresponding Inward Odyssey adventure:
1: Endless Decks
2: Phos Dance
23: Glitch in the Engine
4: A Distant Thunder
5: Mark of the Maker
6: Of Dreams and Memories
7: Blood of the Mother
8: See the Forest
9: Days of Meaninglessness
10: Memory of a Distant Shore
After you resolve the last adventure from this list, flip this card
Flavor B: Your Inward Odyssey continues!
Rules B:
When there are 2 @Progress tokens on this card, discard them and gain +1 @ArgoKnowledge.
When you reach a given @ArgoKnowledge level, during the Story Step, after all other Story events, resolve the corresponding Inward Odyssey adventure:
11: Garden of Solitude
12: The Argonites
13: Children of the Earth
14: Remembrance
15: A Spy Among Us
16: Fire in the Depths
17: United
18: The Final Deterrent
19: Black Blood Cryptex
20: Echoes of Long-Lost Battles

Name: A Nietzschean Welcome
Flavor A:
You have arrived in Lakonia, looking for answers about your origins. Instead, you've found death at the hands of Sparta's cruel, merciless leader, the Nietzschean.
The Nietzschean has issued you a challenge: reach the Temple of Man in 80 days and defeat him. Each day you linger, innocents will die, sacrificed to the new world order. You are the Argonauts. You will not let this stand.
To reach the Temple of Man, you need to navigate the empire's many rivers and canals, the Great River Works, and cross the sluice gates of the First Cataract.
And for that, you need an ignition key and a defector
Summary A: Collect Progress
Rules A: Create the Cycle II Exploration deck: find Cycle II Exploration cards 1-9, 13, 19, 23, 31, and 32 and shuffle them. Take the Cycle II Map tile [078|B078] and place it on the table. Place the Argo on that tile. Gain the [First Cataract Fortification Line|BC1176] Clue card (Story 1A). Mark day 0 on the Timeline. Proceed to the first step of the Campaign Round.\nWhen there are 7 or more @Progress tokens on this card, flip the card to side 1B
Flavor B:
The war rages on, and casualties mount. Even with enemies without and within, the Nietzschean empire is on the offensive. Each day brings new signs of misery: burned vullages and caravans of refugees.
You push forward.
Armed with an ignition key, you set your eyes on the First Cataract. There are four Sluice Gate Fortresses barring the way up north. The key you've recovered will grant you access to one of them. Luckily, you've got a map.
Now, to find a spy who will open it from within..
Summary B: Find the correct Sluice Gate deck
Rules B: Take the four Story 1B Clue cards and shuffle the, to create the [Sluice Gate deck]. Draw the top card and return the rest to the box. Reach the tile indicated by the card (it will include a waterway with the First Cataract Sluice Gate movement symbol). When you enter the correct tile and have at least 1 @Defector, correctly match the clue card to the clue on the tile to begin your assault!

Name: To Win The War
Flavor A:
Your success at the Sluice Gate Fortress has emboldened your allies and disparate rebel groups across Lakonia. As the Argo cuts into Nietzschean territory beyond the First Cataract, and a whole nation rises in open revellion, the front lines are redrawn and the Symmachy gains initiative.
They deem the time has come to end the war with a quick, decisive victory...
The Nietzschean is said to travel between the outlying fortresses, inspecting the troops, which leaves you an opening. If you're able to pinpoint his location or learn of his itinerary, you'll be able to trap him inside a fortress and force him to battle on your terms.
Until that time, you need to build up Resistance in the region. It'll take a concerted effort from you and your allies to bring the tyrant down
Summary A: Find the Nietzschean's location and muster the rebel forces
Rules A:
When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge.
From this point onward, you can freely traverse @Lock waterways with the First Cataract Sluice Gate Fortress @FirstCataract symbol. Note this on your Argo Sheet.
 Gain the [Fortress Map|BC1178] Clue card (Story 2AA). Spartan Stronghold symbols (@SpartanStronghold) denote possible locations of the Nietzschean.
Take the six 2A Clue cards and shuffle them. This is the [Fortress Deck]. Whenever you win a Battle, draw 1 card from the Fortress deck and reveal it. Until the next Battle, the Nietzschean is at the last revealed location. This will become relevant when you progress to side 2B. When you lose a Battle, shuffle all revealed Fortress cards back into the deck.
@Progress tokens placed on this card represent the strength of the Resistance in the region. When there are 6 or more @Progress tokens on this card, flip the card to side 2B. Move the @Progress tokens to side 2B
Flavor B: As the giant Argo trudges through the ambrosia-contaminated canals of the Lakonian heartland, your allies gather in the Bridge Tholos to discuss the operation that will bring the Nietzschean down.\nYou've achieved so much in such a short amount of time, you can hardly believe it. And yet you dread facing the Nietzschean's monstrous shadow on the battlefield, as you still feel outclassed... yet this is it. You've located the Nietzschean and his Temple of Man citadel, and you've cut off all possible escape routes. It's time to call on your allies--on everyone who opposes the Spartan tyranny--and make the final push.\nThe bastard will pay for every drop of innocent blood he's spilled
Summary B: Lay siege to the Fortress and put an end to the Nietzschean
Rules B:
You do not draw any more Fortress cards: the Nietzschean is waiting at the last revealed location. If no Fortress card is currently revealed, draw one now.
@Progress tokens placed on this card represent the strength of the Resistance in the region. When there are at least 10 @Progress on this card and you're on the correct tile with the Spartan Stronghold symbol, during the Story Step you may initiate the Siege of Sparta and see:
10-14 @Progress Ragtag force: 0053.
15-19 @Progress Sizeable force: 0054.
20+ @Progress Overwhelming force: 0055

Name: Argophylae
Flavor A:
You're still reeling from the disaster that was the Battle at the Fortress. The Nietzschean baited you in and closed the trap behind you. He has sacrificed the entire stronghold to deal the revel forces a grave wound--one that they may not recover from.
As your allies scatter for safety, all the might of the Nietzschean empire bears down on the Argo. You thought yourselves untouchable in your gargantuan ship. Well, your enemy is right here to prove you wrong. Nothing is untouchable.
Cyclopean-forged chains have been strung from canal walls. Pursuit armadas of hunter-killer triremes snap at your heels. A barrage of harassment falls on you from above and below, from without and within, day and night, without reprieve. You're tired, broken, trapped.
Out of this gauntlet, you will emerge hardened--or not at all
Summary A: Escape the Argophylae trap and hide in a Resistance Haven
Rules A:
When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge.
Take the seven Story 3A Clue cards and shuffle them to create the [Argophylae deck]. At the end of each Timeline Step, draw 1 card from this deck and resolve it.
Place the Blockade token on the top space of the Blockade diagram on this card. You cannot move the Argo in the direction denoted by the Blockade token. At the end of each Movement Step, move the token 1 space clockwise.
Eligible Resistance havens are @City named in the 2B Story adventure (if you're not sure which, check the noted paragraph again and follow the instructions there).
If the Argophylae deck runs out of cards, shuffle it. If the Argophylae deck runs out of cards for the second time or the Argo is on a Map tile with a friendly Resistance Haven, during the Story Step see 0128
Flavor B:
You are the Argonauts, and you have survived the grinder the Nietzschean has put you through. As you lick your wounds in the relative safety of a Resistance haven, you are able to process how the bastard did it: as the Nietzschean moves, so does his Temple of Man. The Abyss wills it.
If you want to have a chance at defeating him, you need to negate this advantage.
A dangerous plan is set in motion. A strike team will infiltrate the heart of the empire, the very Temple of Man, to seed the unlikeliest of things: a piece of the maze of Crete, courtesy of the Temenos carcass in your cargo hold. Then, Ariadne's Anchor will root the fortress in place.
Now you need to snatch yourselves a few Spartan officials to impersonate
Summary B: Infiltrate the Temple of Man
Rules B: Take the six Blue Clue 3B cards and shuffle the, (for now, put the six Red Clue 3B cards aside). This is the [Identity deck]. Each time you gain a @Progress token, you may draw a card from this deck instead. When you have at least 4 Identity cards, during the Story Step you may see 0143 (however, you may wish to gain more Identity cards before you do that!).

Name: Stand Together
Flavor A:
As you stand on the Acropolis deck, your gaze is drawn to the heart of the empire. You've anchored the Temple of Man and you've learned of the Nietzschean's weakness. You're still not sure you can win, your forces all but depleted, but if you are to lose, you will do it together.
Preparations are well underway on a two-pronged attack: the Argo and the Titans will engage the Nietzschean monstrosity and the Spartan army around the capital, while a second, smaller strike team will once again brave the corridors of the Temple of Man, breach the Throne Room, and attack the mortal Nietzschean directly. Hopefully, he can't fight on two fronts at once.
They start coming at dawn: ships of all shapes and sizes manned by the Helots, caravans of Cyclopes numbering in the dozens, and the triremes of the grand Symmachy Diaspora Fleet. You recognize some of them as veterans of the Battle of the Fortress.
Before you can say anything, a representative of the growing refugee community on the Argo comes to you with a plea: the refugees want to fight too.
"How many?" you ask.
"All of them."
You feel your eyes water.
They have all comel They will all stand with you in the end.
Let's take down the Nietzschean together
Summary A: Attack the Nietzschean on two fronts. End him
Rules A:
When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge.
Immediately reveal the Temple of Man tile (018). Immediately place 1 @Progress token on this card for each Refugee you have. Immediately place a number of @Progress tokens on this card equal to the sum of all Faction Diplomacy Bonuses. Halve the noted Resistance Strength from 2B (rounding up) and place that many additional @Progress tokens.
@Progress placed on this card represents the strength of the Resistance in the region.
When there are at least 10 @Progress tokens on this card and the Argo is on the Temple of Man tile, during the Story Step you may initiate the Siege of the Temple of Man and see 0201.
(*Warning:* This is a *Point of No Return*, you won't be able to return to the Voyage Phase!)
Note: The more @Progress you have here, the stronger your allied force will be during the final confrontation!
Flavor B: The time has come and you mustn't blink. Each battle and decision has led you here. The Nietzschean has a habit of asking people what they are... Show him. Break his hold and power
Summary B: Time and Edge
Rules B:
Place an Edge marker and a Time marker on the Battle track, on space '0' (unless the Edge marker has already been moved).
During the Battle, move the Edge marker 1 space each time the Nietzschean is dealt a Wound (treat a Double Wound as two Wounds). Move the Time marker at the beginning of every Titan Round. When a marker reaches the indicated space or the event happens (in case of the 12th Wound), trigger the appropriate story paragraph (resolve it immediately):
Time 1: see 0212.
Time 2: see 0213.
Edge 6: see 0214.
Time 3: see 0217.
Time 4: see 0220.
Edge 10: see 0222.
12th Wound dealt, see 0224.
*Darkest Hour*
At the start of the Battle, if you gathered a Sizeable or Overwhelming Force, choose a space on the Battle track. Once per Battle, if the Time marker is on the chosen space and a Titan is about to attack, you may immediately place a negative @AT token in the Kratos Pool (2 negative @AT tokens instead if you have Overwhelming Force).
*The Sea of People*
At the start of Battle, place a number of Support tokens (mark them with generic tokens) on this card equal to the number of your @Refugees. During this Battle, when a Titan is about to attack, you may discard exactly 1 Support token to immediately place 1 Opening or Break token in the Kratos Pool.
*Ties that Bind*
If Cyclopes: Allied, the first time a Titan is about to die from a normal Attack (i.e. without any additional Attack type), see 0243.
If Symmachy: Allied, the first time a Titan is about to die from a Judgement Attack, see 0245.
If Helots: Allied, the first time a Titan is about to die from a Zone Attack, see 0244.
*The Battles commenses!*
If you've read all the rules here and in the Storybook, see 0211

Name: Inward Odyssey: Abysswatchers
Flavor A: As you sail through Lakonia, your knowledge of the city-ship grows. Disturbing secrets and shocking revelations are brough to light and force you to reevaluate your Odyssey
Rules A:
When there are 2 @Progress tokens on this card, discard them and gain +1 @ArgoKnowledge.
When you reach a given @ArgoKnowledge level, during the Story Step, after all other Story events, resolve the corresponding Inward Odyssey adventure:
21: Land of the Strong and Free
22: The Price of Difference
23: Scorned Smith
24: Chimeric War
25: The Nymph and the Engine
26: The Means the End
27: The Muse Kids
28: Way of Strength
29: A Titan's View
30: The Rule of the Blade
After you resolve the last adventure from this list, flip this card
Flavor B: Your Inward Odyssey continues!
Rules B:
When there are 2 @Progress tokens on this card, discard them and gain +1 @ArgoKnowledge.
When you reach a given @ArgoKnowledge level, during the Story Step, after all other Story events, resolve the corresponding Inward Odyssey adventure:
31: Blood of the Earth
32: The Fourth
33: As Above, So Below
34: Shadow Play
35:Argo-bred
36: Forsaken Aeons
37: Unyielding
38: Days of Aeons Past
39: Gen 1
40: Song of Life

Name: Icarus's Plea
Flavor A:
Delphi is a land stuck, its people hostage to the whims of the mad Oracles, repeating a cycle of death and destruction over and over again. You have come to free them from this time-locked prison, but also to realize a dream: to go back to a time before the Eschaton and to stop it from ever happening.
A noble goal or a fool's errand? You still haven't decided. Still, an endeavor worth pursuing. Imagine a world without the Eschaton.
As you reached the shores of Delphi, you were visited by the unlikeliest of creatures, Icarus, the son of the Great Inventor. Reluctantly, and with great apprehension, did he urge you to light his father's masterpieces. Before he had a chance to reveal more, he was remvoed from Argo's deck in a brilliant flash...
You need to find Icarus
Summary A: Find Icarus
Rules A: Create the Cycle III Exploration deck: find the Cycle III Exploration cards 1-9, 13, 19, 23, 29-30, 32-34 and shuffle them. Take the Cycle III Map tile 010 and place it on the board. Place the _Argo_ on that tile. Mark day 0 on the Timeline. Proceed to the first step of the Campaign Round.\nWhen there are 6 or more @Progress on this card, see 0008.\nDuring the Story Step of the 6th day, see 0009
Flavor B: The key to finding Icarus lies with his father's last work. The Lighthouses of Delphi have been built to withstand the ravages of time tiself and stave off the wall of void that descends upon the land, the inevitable Timefront. All they needed was the tinder to kindle the fire, one you've brought with you all the way from Crete: Ariadne's Anchor. It seems the shadow of the Great Inventor, Daedalus, is indeed long and dark.\nAnd it begs the question: Has all of this been preordained? Are you doomed to fail and continue this vicious cycle? In Delphi there are supposedly no coincidences. But there was also no hope here, and that you have brought aplenty. Hope will see you through this storm
Summary B: Re-light 5 Daedalus Lighthouses
Rules B:
Each time you reveal a Map tile with a Daedalus Lighthouse symbol, you re-light that Lighthouse. This includes all the Map tiles you already revealed. When you reveal the 5th Lighthouse, during the Story Step, see 0017.
*Note:* Some Lighthouses are still standing in Delphi's Glorious Past, but to reach them, you will need the [Trespass Protocol|CA1611] Technology card.
You can place @Progress token on this card to study the unusual temporal phenomena and the fractured land of Delphi:
2 @Progress: You partially reconstruct the geographical map of Delphi, immediately see 0016.
5+ @Progress: Your academicians re-establish inter-lighthouse connections. This counts as 1 re-lit lighthouse for the purposes of this task

Name: To Those Long Dead
Flavor A:
Delphi is a land stuck, and Icarus a hostage to a Sun God's last will, repeating a cycle of expectations and failure over and over again.
The cycle begins. In the last days before the Eschaton, on the behest of his father, Icarus undertakes a daring mission to reach the Sun in his sky ship, the Aspirant. He doesn't make it. His ship, his crew, all is lost in the incinerating embrace of the Sun's Domain. Icarus falls. He and his crew transform into the tainted creatures plaguing Delphi. The cycle loops.
Poor Icarus keeps falling. and failing. And yet he will contineu to rise until he satisfies his father's command. Bound to repeat this vicious cycle and trap everyone else in it. And each time Delphi is a little less, consumed by the Timefront, the maw of entropy.
Icarus is bound by the Moirai to repeat his mistakes. You are not. Change the past, let Icarus soar. Cancel the Eschaton
Summary A: Change the timeline to help Icarus
Rules A:
When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge.
Take the six Story 2A Clue cards and shuffle them to create the [Events deck]. Draw 3 cards from this deck. These represent the events you need to change to affect the timeline and change the fate of the Aspirant. You need to change 3 events in a Single Time Loop, otherwise you will have to repeat them. For this reason, when you are asked to mark a code in the matrix, don't put it in the Choice Matrix yet, note it separately. If the Loop resets (i.e. you resolve the Loop effect), erase those noted codes. You will only mark these in the Matrix once you see the paragraph below.
You can collect @Progress tokens on this card. They will come in handy later and will also have some immediate benefits, allowing you to choose from a wider variety of events:
1 @Progress: Draw another event (you still need to change only 3 events).
3 @Progress: Draw another event (you still need to change only 3 events).
5+ @Progress: Draw another event (you still need to change only 3 events).
As soon as you change 3 events in a Single Time Loop, see 0059
Flavor B: It should have worked. You did everything you agreed upon and events, for once, did flow differently. Yet the time loop is still here, Delphi trapped, time-locked, slowly consumed by the voracious Timefront.\nDid Icarus fail or have you been deceived? Or is there something else at play here, hidden? Impossible to tell at this point. The Last Academy is tracking the descent trajectory of a near-sun object, both through time and space. The Aspirant, the sky chariot of Icarus. You need to locate it
Summary B: Calculate the course of the Aspirant. Collect Progress
Rules B: Move all @Progress tokens from side 2A here. When there are 9 or @Progress on this card, see 0083

Name: Box Of Black
Flavor A: The Chariot crash-landed in the outer reaches of Delphi, in the bleak future from which the Twilight Watch hails, the future you are trying to avert by stopping the Eschaton.\nYou've crossed the timeslip several times now, small reconnaissance missions as you look for a way to bring the Argo into the future of Delphi to look for the Aspirant. Each time, dark thoughts assail you. The ice-locked wastes are still there. Icarus's mission must have failed, and you haven't changed anything after all. The Primordials, too, are still here, more powerful than ever.\nYou need to find the Aspirant, the heavenly chariot, and it master and commander, Icarus. Learn what went wrong
Summary A: Find any chariot piece
Rules A:
When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge.
Take the three remaining Story 3A Clue cards and shuffle them to create the [Chariot Map deck].
You need to find a chariot piece depicted on any of the Maps you have acquired (including the one you already have). Chariot pieces are represented on the Map tiles with the Chariot A and Chariot B symbols.
*Note:* The chariot pieces are scattered in the future, to which you can travel only if you have the [Icebreaker Protocol] Technology card.
You can collect @Progress to gain additional Chariot Maps:
2+ @Progress: Draw a card form the Chariot Map deck
5+ @Progress: Draw a card form the Chariot Map deck
9+ @Progress: Draw the last card form the Chariot Map deck.
*Finding the Aspirant:* If the Argo is on the same Map tile as a Chariot A or Chariot B symbol, during the Story step, see 0108
Flavor B:
You have met with Icarus, but not the one from before. Not the merciful broken angel constantly failing to live up to expectations, but a creature strong, and cold, and calculating, one that went to the sun and came back transformed.
Uncaring and callous, this "perfected" Icarus wants to ascend to Helios's throne, to godhood, and so finally surpass his father. So it seems he is still the old Icarus: living in Daedalus's shadow, measuring his worth through the Great Inventor's pitiless eyes.
Icarus told you one more thing: The desolate Delphi you have been voyaging through is one untouched by the Eschaton. This is the future you wanted to bring back all this time. So now you know: The only way is forward.
The chase after the self-styled Sun's descendant to the Domain of Helios hidden high above Delphi, in the clouds, you will need a heaven-worthy vessel. A Chariot of your own
Summary B: Locate the rest of the chariot
Rules B:
You need to find another chariot piece, one that matches the one you have already found, so either another @ChariotB or @ChariotA symbol.
Move all @Progress tokens from side 3A onto this side (but do not draw additional Chariot Map cards for move @Progress). You can then continue collecting @Progress to gain additional Chariot Maps:
2+ @Progress: Draw a card form the Chariot Map deck
5+ @Progress: Draw a card form the Chariot Map deck
9+ @Progress: Draw the last card form the Chariot Map deck.\*Finding the other part of the Chariot:* If the _Argo_ is on the same Map tile as @ChariotB or @ChariotA symboland this symbol matches the symbol on the first Chariot part you found, during the Story Step, see 0118.\When this story card is revealed erase your current Loop End from the timeline, then count X days from the current day and mark the last day as the Loop End. X is your Loop Length.
*An End to All Things: If, at any point, you reach the Loop End, you lose the game. Remember, you can always force a Loop effect using the* [Chronosail|CA1610] *Technology*

Name: Trespassing
Flavor A: The loop is tightening. Icarus is ready to ascend the Vacant Throne, crush the Argo and Delphi along with it. You... you are not ready to be crushed just yet. As it fell, Icarus's heavenly chariot broke into pieces and has been damaged beyond repair.\nArgo Works is building a new one using the parts you have salvaged, old Hyperborean tekne, and the Argo's own systems. The Phoinikos. They're certain you will be able to achieve flight, if only for a little while. A little while is all you need.\nHowever, you're missing a crucial part, one that was destroyed a long time ago. The Argo's twilight is nigh, as its destiny looms, eager to close the circle
Summary A: Procure parts for the Argo
Rules A:
When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge.
Add the _Trespass_ Event to the Timeline X days from today. During the Story Step of that day, see 0135.
X is:
If it's day 85+: 1 day.
If it's day 80-84: 2 days.
If it's day 75-79: 3 days.
If it's day 70-74: 5 days.
If it's day 69 or earlier: 8 days.
*An End to All Things: If, at any point, you reach the Loop End, you lose the game. Remember, you can always force a Loop effect using the* [Chronosail|CA1610] *Technology*
Flavor B:
This is it. The final ascent.
As Phoinikos takes flight, you are reminded of all that made you embark on this journey and all that made you a beacon of hope for Hellas. For a while, you too became time-locked, not by divine power or the verdict of the Moirai, but by the alluring promise of past's embrace, of misplaced nostalgia. Yet a people looking back will never progress.
So no more of that. The only way is forward. Not to stop the Eschaton, but to rise from its ashes.
You set your course for the Sun's Domain
Summary B: Reach the Sun's Domain. End this
Rules B:
*Phoinikos, the Argo:* The Argo Works have built you a new, flying ship, a heavenly chariot of your own! Instead of a normal move, you may resolve one or both of these effects:
--Place the _Argo_ miniature on any explored space with the @Lighthouse symbol,
--Move up to 3 tiles (you must stop on the first unexplored Map tile); you only resolve the symbols and effects of the tile you stop on.
*Reach the Sun's Domain:* During any Story Step, you may see 0160 (*Warning: This is a Point of No Return, you won't be able to return to the Voyage Phases*).
*An End to All Things: If, at any point, you reach the Loop End, you lose the game. Remember, you can always force a Loop effect using the* [Chronosail|CA1610] *Technology*

Name: Inward Odyssey: Pitiless Of The Sun
Flavor A: As you sail through Delphi, your knowledge of the city-ship grows. Forbidden truths about the Argo and the Eschaton are revealed
Rules A:
When there are 2 @Progress tokens on this card, discard them and gain +1 @ArgoKnowledge.
When you reach a given @ArgoKnowledge level, during the Story Step, after all other Story events, resolve the corresponding Inward Odyssey adventure:
41: Throne of Heavens
42: Burden of Proof
43: In God's Name
44: Crisis of Faith
45: A Day Under the Sun
46: Mother Dark
47: To Grasp the Stars
48: Inherintence
49: Holy Murder
50: Unto Dawn
After you resolve the last adventure from this list, flip this card
Flavor B: Your Inward Odyssey continues!
Rules B:
When there are 2 @Progress tokens on this card, discard them and gain +1 @ArgoKnowledge.
When you reach a given @ArgoKnowledge level, during the Story Step, after all other Story events, resolve the corresponding Inward Odyssey adventure:
51: The First Junction
52: Shadow of the Mountain
53: Machina Ex Deus
54: The Iron Extinction
55: Sacred Weapons
56: The Typhon Comes
57: How the World Was Born
58: Trespassing Aeons
59: How the World Was Murdered
60: Perpetual Motion

Name: Law of Bargains
Flavor A: Pandora built a tower that holds all the curses. To topple it, you need to find it, and to find it, you need to speak with the cursed ruler of Persia. And before you can even face him, you need to stop the Empire from crushing and swallowing you whole... by becoming recognized by it, under the Law of Bargains.\nIn the Land Thrice-Cursed, all kneel to this Law, even the king. As the Argo sails through the sands, deeper into the Eternal Empire, you know you need to familiarize yourself with its rules too. Not to kneel, but to bend. Use it against them and buy yourselves time to search for Xerxes.
Summary A: Collect Progress and submit to the Law of Bargains
Rules A:
Create the Cycle IV Exploration deck: find Cycle IV Exploration cards 1-6, 8, 9, 19, 23 and 27-37 and shuffle them. Take the Cycle IV Map cards 029, 052, and 074, randomly choose one, and return the rest. Place the chosen card on the table, then place the Argo on that card. Mark day 0 on the Timeline. Proceed to the first step of the Campaign Round.
*Ceaseless Aggression:* As long as you are on Story 1A, at the start of each Timeline Battle add 1 random Cursed Trait.
*Acclimation note!* The first Acclimation is tied to the Law of Bargains.You cannot @Lock acclimate your Exploration deck as long as you are on the Story 1A card. If you advance the Timeline to the second Acclimation while on Story 1A, you lose the campaign; see the _Barren Aeons_ Special Event.
Each time you gain, you may place 1 @Progress token on this card. When there are 5 or more @Progress tokens on this card, during the Story Step, see 0015.
Flavor B: You leave the palace-city posthaste; its streets, gilded with promises and the labor of the less fortunate, becoming insufferably suffocating. You have been granted a Writ of Belonging, but the writ is useless without the seal of a high Imperial official. Yet more busywork, another indirect attack against the Argo, to stall and aggravate.\nYou will find this Eternal Treasurer and make him stamp the Writ, of his own free will... or otherwise. You cannot waste more time.
Summary B: Visit 5 Empire Treasuries and bargain with the Eternal Treasurer
Rules B:
You need to find the touring office of the Eternal Treasurer to make him stamp your Writ of Belonging. Each time you explore a new Map tile with a City @City, you visit the local bablos official. This automatically, retroactively, includes all the Map tiles you have already explored up to this point. When you reveal the 5th City this way, during the Story Step, see 0038.
You can place @Progress tokens on this card to pay for bribes and bring the bablos to you:
2 @Progress: For the purposes of this task, treat this Story card as 1 explored City @City.
5 @Progress: For the purposes of this task, treat this Story card as 2 explored Cities @City.
7+ @Progress: For the purposes of this task, treat this Story card as 3 explored CÃ­ties @City
*Ceaseless Aggression:* As long as you are on Story 1B, at the start of each Timeline Battle add 1 random Cursed Trait.
*Acclimation note!* The first Acclimation is tied to the Law of Bargains. You cannot @Lock acclimate your Exploration deck as long as you are on the Story 1B card. If you advance the Timeline to the second Acclimation, while on Story 1B, you lose the campaign; see the _Barren Aeons_ Special Event.

Name: Splendor That Beggars Belief
Flavor A: As newly minted citizens of the Eternal Empire, you are free to roam its vast deserts, at least nominally. With the Writ of Belonging came surprising insight into the way Xerxes rules his domain: from afar, with curses and invisible hands, hidden behind a veil of laws, procedures, and officials.\nAnd a Wish-veil, for good measure, whatever that is.\nYou will pierce them all. And once you stand before this so-called God-King, you will make him loosen his grasp, on the Argo, on this ill-fated land. In Delphi, you brought down a radiant god; you can deal with a cheap imitation
Summary A: Find the City of Splendor
Rules A:
When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge.
*Acclimation note!* If you have already advanced the Timeline past the first Acclimation, as soon as you reach Story 2A and read this, perform this Acclimation.
Take the six Story 2A Clue cards, shuffle them, then, without looking, remove one and return it to the box (you won't be using it). The remaining 5 cards form the Search for Splendor deck. Then, take the City of Splendor token, as well as 5 City of Squalor tokens, and place them near the Story card. You will place these tokens on the map.
If you start the Story step on an empty @City tile (one that does not have the Last Visited City token or any other tokens on it), draw a Search for Splendor card and follow its instructions. After that, if don't find the City of Splendor, place a City of Squalor token on the @City to denote it.
You can place @Progress tokens on this card to pay for bribes that will hasten your search:
2 @Progress: Without looking at it, discard 1 Clue card.
4 @Progress: Without looking at it, discard 1 Clue card.
7+ @Progress: Without looking at it, discard 1 Clue card.\If you are ever forced to discard your last Clue card, resolve it immediately
Flavor B: You could say you have pierced the Wish-veil and witnessed the true shape of things, but that would be an exaggeration. You are still chasing phantoms, though of a more pronounced shape now. The Collateral Emir escapes, and you have a hunch he will lead you to the Hanging Gardens, among the clouds, where, finally, you will face the God-King Xerxes.\nHis list of crimes against you--and the people of Persia--has grown considerably since you first arrived in the Thrice-Cursed Land, and if that is any indication of how things were before, it may truly be infinite. Is there even a punishment severe enough for one so guilty?
Summary B: Chase the Collateral Emir's cloud ship!
Rules B:
You will find the full rules of the chase in paragraph 0093. Keep the storybook open; you'll be referring to it often!
If you located the Hanging Gardens, place their marker on the indicated Map tile.
Travel to the Hanging Gardens.
If the _Argo_ is on the same Map tile as the Hanging Gardens marker, during the Story Step, see 1112

Name: The Rope Sellers
Flavor A:
The Hanging Gardens turned out to be a dead end, which, in a sense, is par for the course for your voyage across the Land Thrice-Cursed. It is as if the people here have mad eit their trade to lie and obfuscate, to the point where nothing seems truly real anymore, not even your ship and its mission.
You are the Argonauts, though, and you do not simply quit. You will struggle against adversity until your very last breaths, so long as there is even the tiniest thread to follow.
And that is why you embark on a search for the Graves of the Anemoi, the source of the counterweight gas that literally keeps the Eternal Empire afloat. Maybe it is the missing link to Pandora's Jar. Maybe it will become a weapon against it. Maybe.
It is something, at least
Summary A: Look for information about the Graves of the Anemoi
Rules A: When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge.\nCheck the following Map tiles in order and stop as soon as you arrive at a Map tile not already explored. That is the Map tile where the Old Refinery City is located. The Map tiles you check (in order) are: [004|D004], [008|D008], [024|D024], [028|D028], [036|D036], [040|D040], [042|D042], [048|D048], [050|D050], [062|D062], [073|D073], [076|D076]. If, for some reason, you have explored all of these Map tiles, you can choose which one of them has the Old Refinery City (do it now).\nEach time you gain @Progress, you gain @Progress, you may place 1 @Progress token on this card. When there are 5 or more @Progress tokens on this card, and you are on the Old Refinery City Map tile, during the Story Step, see 1207
Flavor B: After a quick stop at a rundown refinery city--even its name eludes you now--you have learned the coordinates of the closest active deposit of the subterranean conterweight gas. A Grave of the Anemoi, if you believe the legends.\nYou have also witnessed the wasting effects the gas has on those who have handled it, and the remorseless attitude the Eternal Empire has toward those who are no longer useful to it, loyal citizens or not.\nYou set off toward the Grave
Summary B: Travel to the Grave of the Anemoi
Rules B: You will find the full rules of this Story in paragraph 1211 (the same paragraph that directed you to take this card). In short, you need to travel to a Grave of the Anemoi. There are several on the Map, but some are exhausted, not eligible--if you're not sure which, check the aformentioned paragraph.\nIf the _Argo_ is on the same Map tile as an active Grave of the Anemoi, during the Story Step, see 1331

Name: A Mortal's Reach
Flavor A: The mural at the Grave of the Anemoi had a transformative effect, illuminating that which was previously hidden from you. It hel a deeper truth still, some kind of cipher, but this newfound knowledge was quite enough for you to go on. The veil of deceit is coming apart at the seams. You just have to pull at it a little while longer
Summary A: Collect Progress to ponder on what you have realized, or see beyond it
Rules A: When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge (see rules). Each time you gain @Progress, you may place 1 @Progress on this card. When there are 9 or more @Progress tokens on this card, flip it
Flavor B:
The Tower of Pandora has goaded you from the moment you set foot in Persia, always there, in the corner of your eye, ready to appear at a moment's notice to dispense its curses.
You did not deserve it, just as the peoples of Persian have done nothing to deserve the yoke of Infinite Growth. And yet, you both allowed yourselves to be deceived into believing that you had. Into self-loathing. Into guilt. Into debt.
No more.
Today, the tower falls, and growth stops
Summary B: Reach Pandora's Jar
Rules B: *Immediately: See 3300*.\n*Reach Pandora's Jar:* If the _Argo_ is on the Pandora's Jar Map tile, during the Story Step, you may see 3306 *(Warning: This is a Point of No Return; you won't be able to return to the Voyage Phase beyond this point)*.

Name: Inward Odyssey: Gardens of Infinite Growth
Flavor A: As you sail through the Thrice-Cursed Land of Persia, your knowledge of the city-ship grows. Illusions are dispersed, and a final course is charted
Rules A:
When there are 2 @Progress tokens on this card, discard them and gain +1 @ArgoKnowledge.
When you reach a given @ArgoKnowledge level, during the Story Step, after all other Story events, resolve the corresponding Inward Odyssey adventure:
61: Daybreak
62: Polyphemos
63: The Glassblower
64: The Glorious Climb
65: The King and the Philosopher
66: The Great Crime
67: The Last Lotus Eater
68: Cast to the Four
69: Long Voyage Home
70: Titanaktisos
After you resolve the last adventure from this list, flip this card
Flavor B: Your Inward Odyssey continues!
Rules B:
When there are 2 @Progress tokens on this card, discard them and gain +1 @ArgoKnowledge.
When you reach a given @ArgoKnowledge level, during the Story Step, after all other Story events, resolve the corresponding Inward Odyssey adventure:
71: The Island of Pigs
72: A Girl from Uruk
73: Smoke and Mirrors
74: The Sun Endures
75: Due Time
76: Gardens of the Moon
77: The Laestrygonian
78: Jason
79: Kiss of Mnemosyne
80: Nostos

Name: What Remains?
Flavor A:
You came to the Cyclades to realize the late Old Priest's plan. Bring hope to its people and put an end to the threat of the long Eschaton once and for all. Free Hellas from the shackles of the gods, Primordials, and black ambrosia in one fell swoop.
It took years to finally get here. THousands have come and gone from the Argo in the meantime, conscripts and refugees from Crete, Sparta, Delphi, Persia, and all the other disparate places you have not visited, but which have heard about you and your mission, and decided to throw their lots with the Odyssey.
The list of the decorated and the dead covers many steles of the Heroon. Countless nameless Titans have been killed in action, the only evidence of their existence the notches on the walls of the Titan Stoa. So many notches.
Challenges overcome. Empires toppled. Tyrants slain. Sacrifices made and paid in full. Lifetimes of struggle.
For it all to spectacularly fail before your eyes. For it to cause untold devastation and make things worse. To unleash a monster that could drown the world in flames. Ur-Fleece.
Without recourse, without a plan, you are left to ask: what remains?
Summary A: Discard Progress and help the people of the Cyclades deal with the Disaster, as you look for the Virtuary
Rules A:
Create the Cycle V Exploration deck by finding the Cycle V Exploration cards 1-6, 8, 9, 19, 23, 29, and 31-36 and shuffling them. Then, take the Cycle V Map card [047|E047] and place it, surface face up, on the table, then place the _Argo_ on that card. Mark day 0 on the Timeline. Proceed to the first step of the Campaign Round.
*On reveal:* Place 4 @Progress tokens on this card.
Each time you would gain @Progress, discard 1 @Progress token from this card. If there are no more tokens on this card, see 0028.
*You may discard tokens from this card only if the Last Visited City token is on the Map, on a surface City* @City *space*
Flavor B: A decade ago, the Protectorate emerged as the major power of the Cyclades, putting an end to years of lawlessness and religious strife. They promised safety and prosperity. Today, the archipelago is nothing but. Today, their control is slipping.\nYou travel the Great Sea, bringing relief to the victims of the Disaster, straddling the divide between the Protectorate and the Vanguard of Atlantis, returning to claim what they perceive is their birthright. Ever on the lookout for the Virtuary, who many call "Truthsayer," and whom the Truth Machine marked as the only one who can stop Ur-Fleece.\nBehind you, the Nemesis. Ahead of you, a conflict with the Symmachy who wish to take the Argo away
Summary B: Discard Progress and help the people of the Cyclades deal with the Disaster, as you look for the Virtuary
Rules B:
*On reveal:* If the Nemesis has not yet entered play, place the _Nemesis_ miniature on the closest @City tile not occupied by the _Argo_.
*On reveal:* Place 3 @Progress tokens on this card.
Each time you would gain @Progress, discard 1 @Progress token from this card.
If there are no more tokens on this card, see 0039.
You may discard tokens from this card only if the Last Visited City token is on the Map, on a surface City @City space.

Name: The Enemy of My Enemy
Flavor A: On the shores of Ios, an old foe has reappeared. For once, you have gained the upper hand, thanks to an unlikely ally, who you believe to have been the Virtuary. Few would doubt the near-prophetic words of the Truth Machine.\nYet the encounter has opened old wounds and sowed fear among the crew. Against your wishes, stories of a fabled refuge called "Unknown Delos" spread in hushed whispers. Though you understand the weariness and the desire ot finally lay down arms, you will not abandon your mission to look for something... that may not even exist.\nUnlike myths, you now know the Virtuary is a man of blood and bones, and men leave trails
Summary A: Find someone who can lead you to the Virtuary
Rules A: When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge.\nEach time you gian @Progress, you may place 1 @Progress on this card. When there are 4 or more @Progress on this card, during the Story Step, see 0911
Flavor B:
With the Nemesis spreading their holy terror and Ur-Fleece boiling the seas, the Cyclades once again drown in fear. Many await a promised Truthsayer to come and wash away their grief and pain in one tidal wave of truth, and many seize this opportunity to proclaim themselves prophet. The Punished was only the beginning.
Another, arguably, is the Virtuary, though you believe him to be different. The Machine marked him. He is the key to defeating Ur-Fleece and quelling the rising flames...
And you finally know where to find him. White Haven, a hidden Followers of Arete hermitage, whose trappings purposefully tap into the imagery of the mythical refuge of Unknown Delos. The Virtuary is supposed to be there, making an address to his inner circle.
Now... you just need to locate it
Summary B: Find the location of 'White Haven'
Rules B: If you start the Story Step on an Underwater @City tile that does not have the Last Visited Underwater City token or any other tokens on it, see 0577.\nDuring this Story card, if you wish, you may place additional @Progress here. This @Progress represents your research into 'Unknown Delos'

Name: Quietly Into the Night
Flavor A: At Eusebes, the Follower hermitage of White Haven, you have found only ghosts and death... and the Last Hierei's desire. He is not interested in you or the Argo at all, but rather in what it currently holds: the Truth Machine, which he thinks is the genuine article, not a Mnestis-generated simulacrum. He believes it will tell him how to bring Poseidon back from the dead. "A priest should never drink his own poison," says Jason. "HIs faith is his weakness, which we might yet exploit..."\nThe Argo is not the only lead the Last Heirei is following. There once was an original Truth Machine, remember, one lost with the fall of Anostos, Atlantis's capital. Now that the metropolis is rumored to have been reclaimed, others will soon find their way there.\nYou need to get there before the Nemesis does
Summary A: Collect Progress and find Anostos, the fallen capital of Atlantis
Rules A:
When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge.
*Immediately: see 1399*.
You now have a Phos Map that supposedly leads to the capital of Atlantis. You need to find the tile shown on that Map card.
Each time you gain @Progress, you may place 1 @Progress token on this card. Then, if you have:
3+ @Progress: Gain another, random Story 3A Clue card (cards 3AA-3AF).
5+ @Progress: Check your Phos Map cards for deatils on new actions.
If you start the Story Step on a tile you think is the correct one, match the clue form the card to the clue on the tile to find a paragraph number! If you are correct, place the Atlantean Capital marker on your tile and proceed to the appropriate paragraph.
*Important: Be sure you're ready for what is to come*.
Flavor B: You went to Anostos to stop the Last Hierei from finding a way to awaken his dead god, Poseidon. Needlessly. For he is already on his way. Has been, since that fateful night on Thera. Thanks to you.\nThe Last Hierei does not know. Yet. He will, once he gets his hands on the Argo and the Truth Machine. You can't go against him and his indominable ship, the Nemesis, alone. You hate to admit it, but... you need help. You need the Symmachy
Summary B: Rendezvous with the Symmachy fleet
Rules B:
*Immediately:* If the Doom card number is lower than the Story card number, during the Doom Step, flip or archive the current Doom card, triggering any relevant paragraph.
Add the _Rendezvous_ Event to the Timeline X days from today. During the Story Step of that day, see 2407.
X is:
If it's day 65+: 1 day.
If it's day 60+: 6 days.
If it's day 50+: 12 days.
If it's day 40+: 18 days.
If it's day 39 or earlier: 20 days.
You don't need @Progress for this Story! However, if you wish, you may place additional @Progress here. This @Progress represents your research into 'Unknown Delos'

Name: The Sleep of Reason
Flavor A: You have left the Symmachy fleet behind, and with it any notion that they will help you. No one will. Poseidon is waking. Unbeknownst, the Last Hierei comes for you to hasten his return.\nYou last hope is to hide. Remove yourselves from the world, so the Last Hierei never claims the damned thing. There is only one place in the whole Cyclades where one might find shelter from all harm, a mythical refuge. Unknown Delos.\nIf it exists. If you can find your way to it
Summary A: Find Unknown Delos
Rules A:
When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge.
*Immediately::* If the Doom card number is lower than 3, during the Doom Step, flip or archive the current Doom card, triggering any relevant paragraph.
*Immediately:* See 2406.
*End of Hope:* Disable the [Hope Logic|AA0038] Technology card.
Take the seven 4A Clue cards and shuffle them. This is the [Unknown Delos] deck. When you visit any City @City, a tile with a Ruins token on it, or a Silver Remnant @SilverRemnant, during the Story Step, draw an Unknown Delos card and place a Generic token on the visited location to mark it as searched (you cannot gain any more Unknown Delos card from that tile).
The Unknown Delos cards will reveal to you the place you need to go--a paragraph number. When you know the number, simply proceed to it. The paragraph you're looking for will be marked be a @FragmentedCircle tag.
*Warning:* This is a Point of No Return
Flavor B:
You sought Unknown Delos, and, after much struggle, you have found it. You wish you haven't. There is no refuge. Never was. Not for the Silver People. Not for you. Not even for the god-in-tatters. Just fairy tales to help children sleep at night.
There is... nothing for you to do now. Nowhere to run, or hide. With a myriad foes around you, with a ship that is at this very moment failing, you stand no chance of facing even the pale shadow of Ur-Fleece.
What remains?
You are the Argonauts. You will go out the same way you lived: swinging
Summary B: Help the Cycladeans for as long as you can and go out swinging
Rules B: *Immediately:* If the Doom card number is lower than 3B, during the Doom Step, flip or archive the current Doom card, triggering any relevant paragraph.\n*End of Hope:* Disable the [Hope Logic|AA0038] Technology card. You cannot gain @Crew. When you lose -1 @Crew, you may instead gain +1 @Doom. When you emergency submerge, you may gain +1 @Doom instead of losing -1 @Hull

Name: Inward Odyssey: Truthsayer
Flavor A: As you sail through the Cyclades, you begin to piece it all together
Rules A:
When there are 2 @Progress tokens on this card, discard them and gain +1 @ArgoKnowledge.
When you reach a given @ArgoKnowledge level, during the Story Step, after all other Story events, resolve the corresponding Inward Odyssey adventure:
81: My Ship
82: All Great Truths
83: A Life Unfinished
84: I Am the Message
85: The Great Hierei

Name: Have it
Flavor A:
It was always there, at the very bottom, beyond the dark, the doubt, and the despair, waiting for you to rekindle it.
Hope.
Hope to quench the fires, destroy Poseidon and honor a legacy. Everything you need to end it you either already know, possess or will find onboard your sister-ship, the Nemesis. Whose leader is singularly obsessed with something you have. The Truth Machine.
So... why not take a cue from Odysseus's Trojan playbook?.
And give it to him
Summary A: Reach the _Nemesis_ and get yourselves 'eaten' by the gargantuan warship
Rules A:
When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge..
*Time is Ticking:* When you gain @Doom tokens, place them on this card. If there are ever 5 or more @Doom tokens here, it's game over. See 4214. When you flip this card, move all @Doom tokens to the other side,
*Last One Out:* For the purposes of Adventure Hub selection, treat this card as if it was Story 4B.
If you start the Story Step on a tile that contains the _Nemesis_, see 5989
Flavor B:
The Last Hierei finally got to meet his maker.
You? You are on your way to the Dark Below, the deepest trench of the Great Sea, where the carcass of Poseidon rots, not quite as dead as you would have hoped. It needs a little push. The payload you've liberated from the Nemesis should remedy that.
Without the 13th Muse Grand Cannon, you have no delivery mechanism... save for the Argo itself. Your crew begins to evacuate.
One way or another, this is your final voyage
Summary B: Find Ur-Fleece and end it
Rules B: *Time is Ticking:* When you gain @Doom tokens, place them on this card. If there are ever 5 or more @Doom tokens here, it's game over. See 4214.
